publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2040 Pauline McNeill: Maggie's Centre—That the Parliament congratulates the Maggie's Centre at Glasgow Western Infirmary on its success in securing a £382,000 Heritage Lottery Grant, and notes that this money will enable the North Glasgow University Hospitals NHS Trust to redevelop the derelict Kelvingrove Gatehouse Lodge into the first dedicated cancer support centre in the West of Scotland.
S1M-2040 Maggie's Centre (lodged on 22 June 2001) Irene Oldfather*
S1M-2040 Maggie's Centre (lodged on 22 June 2001) Ms Sandra White*, Donald Gorrie*, Mr Michael McMahon*
S1M-2040 Maggie's Centre (lodged on 22 June 2001) Tommy Sheridan*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*
S1M-2040 Maggie's Centre (lodged on 22 June 2001) Janis Hughes*, Mrs Mary Mulligan*, Brian Fitzpatrick*, Fiona McLeod*

S1M-2040 Pauline McNeill: Maggie's Centre—That the Parliament congratulates the Maggie's Centre at Glasgow Western Infirmary on its success in securing a £382,000 Heritage Lottery Grant, and notes that this money will enable the North Glasgow University Hospitals NHS Trust to redevelop the derelict Kelvingrove Gatehouse Lodge into the first dedicated cancer support centre in the West of Scotland. Supported by: Irene Oldfather, Ms Sandra White, Donald Gorrie, Mr Michael McMahon, Tommy Sheridan, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Janis Hughes, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Brian Fitzpatrick, Fiona McLeod
S1M-2040 Maggie's Centre (lodged on 22 June 2001) Mary Scanlon*
S1M-2040 Maggie's Centre (lodged on 22 June 2001) Dr Richard Simpson*, Elaine Smith*

S1M-2040 Pauline McNeill: Maggie's Centre-That the Parliament congratulates the Maggie's Centre at Glasgow Western Infirmary on its success in securing a £382,000 Heritage Lottery Grant, and notes that this money will enable the North Glasgow University Hospitals NHS Trust to redevelop the derelict Kelvingrove Gatehouse Lodge into the first dedicated cancer support centre in the West of Scotland. Supported by: Irene Oldfather, Ms Sandra White, Donald Gorrie, Mr Michael McMahon, Tommy Sheridan, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Janis Hughes, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Brian Fitzpatrick, Fiona McLeod, Mary Scanlon, Dr Richard Simpson, Elaine Smith
S1M-2040 Maggie's Centre (lodged on 22 June 2001) Mr Kenneth Gibson*
S1M-2040 Maggie's Centre (lodged on 22 June 2001) Trish Godman*

S1M-2040 Pauline McNeill: Maggie's Centre—That the Parliament congratulates the Maggie's Centre at Glasgow Western Infirmary on its success in securing a £382,000 Heritage Lottery Grant, and notes that this money will enable the North Glasgow University Hospitals NHS Trust to redevelop the derelict Kelvingrove Gatehouse Lodge into the first dedicated cancer support centre in the West of Scotland. Supported by: Irene Oldfather, Ms Sandra White, Donald Gorrie, Mr Michael McMahon, Tommy Sheridan, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Janis Hughes, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Brian Fitzpatrick, Fiona McLeod, Mary Scanlon, Dr Richard Simpson, Elaine Smith, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Trish Godman
S1M-2040 Maggie's Centre (lodged on 22 June 2001) Dorothy-Grace Elder*

Supported by: Irene Oldfather, Ms Sandra White, Donald Gorrie, Mr Michael McMahon, Tommy Sheridan, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Janis Hughes, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Brian Fitzpatrick, Fiona McLeod, Mary Scanlon, Dr Richard Simpson, Elaine Smith, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Trish Godman, Dorothy-Grace Elder
